data.title: ASCOPE
data.text:
Lao State Fuel Company (LSFC), a 100% state owned enterprise, was established in 1976 as a fuel unit belonged to a department of the Ministry of Material and Supply and was named as a Fuel Supply Company in 1980.

In 1986 LSFC was converted into a new business enterprise which is called Lao State Fuel Company, until now.

LSFC has played a significant role in stabilizing petroleum energy for national socio-economic development and security, and doing business competing with other private oil companies.

Through over 30 years of her existence and experiences, LSFC has successfully expanded and developed her economic infrastructure for maintaining stability of fuel supply for national socio-economic development and environmental preservation.

Now, LSFC has seven branches in every major province, fuel depots and warehouses with a total capacity of 26 million litres, laboratory, and 326 gas service stations throughout the country. In addition, LSFC has also additional business units, namely a modern transport fleet with a number of over 140 trucks, tank welding factory, fuel infrastructure construction unit, Jet fuel service, and LPG cooking gas service.

LSFC has steadily been growing up in many fields and able to supply fuel for domestic consumption and partly for re-exporting to neighboring countries. Each year, her imports and distribution have been increased according to the increasing fuel consumption of the country and has become the leader in domestic fuel market with a market share of more than 30%. With a given role in ASCOPE, LSFC is expected grow further with more challenges and opportunities in her business.

VISION

Being a national leading oil company.

MISSION

Provide good and stable supply for society and national development.
